text: Civil Aviation University of China (Simplified Chinese 中国民航大学, Traditional Chinese 中國民航大學, Pinyin Zhōngguó Mínháng Dàxué), also known as CAUC, is a national university in Tianjin, China. It offers education and training in civil aviation for new pilots in China. "Wu Tongshui, Principal of the Civil Aviation University of China Receives the French Aeronautical Medal of Honor," China Civil Aviation Report (CCAR), Volume 14, Issue 1, Spring 2012; retrieved 2012-5-26. ==History== CAUC was founded in 1951. ==Related pages== * Wu Tongshui * French Civil Aviation University ==References== ==Other websites== *http://www.cauc.edu.cn/ Category:Aviation organizations Category:Colleges and universities in the People's Republic of China Category:1951 establishments in Asia Category:1950s establishments in China
title: Civil Aviation University of China
